content.description: Top rope. A comination of sandy rails and ledges for good feet. Start on a boulder At the base and work your way straight up. Helmets are a must since there are loose rock patches and rocks hanging around on the small ledges. Trail at the top of the area provides healthy trees for top rope anchors. This wall can get very wet after a rain so it's best climbed after a big of dry weather.
content.protection: Top rope. Anchor built from trees up top.
content.location:
South of Roxboro Middle School, where Roxboro road would cross Doan Brook if it continued south to the other side. On the north side of the Brook 

  This climb is located on the first vertical wall just to the right of a low angle slab section covered in graffiti and moss. Head down the path towards to stream and pass an overhanging Boulder section. Follow the path over fallen boulders, around the corner, and come across a chossed out slabby areas on your left. The route is the first clean verticals section 20 ft past the slab area.  Nice 35 ft climb.

climbs.name: Super Geranium
climbs.fa: It is very possible that this is an extension that has been climbed before

content.description: Start left hand on the top left most pocket in the left side of the boulder and right hand on either of the two pockets about 1.5 feet about the "CTP" carved into the rock, traverse right through the middle section of the rock trying to avoid the extremely massive feet, and eventually finishing on Geranium
content.location: This starts on the left most section of the graffitied boulder that also has Geranium, Snapdragon, and Daphodil. This boulder is located in the section of the pocket across the street from in between Delaware street and Bellfield at coordinates: 41.494889,-81.595251

content.description: The first few moves are a bit tricky with bad feet. After getting past the start the route is really simple, essentially a ladder with a slightly slabby finish.
content.protection: No bolts, you need to make an anchor at the top.
content.location: Entering Doan Brook across from Roxboro Rd. You move down the hill. Past a big wall of graffiti, keep moving down the stream until you see "Squid Squad" Spray painted on the wall. The route is directly to the left.

content.description: Follow the obvious incut jugs moving from bottom right to the middle top. Good hands bad feet, pretty fun
Start low on left arête sidepull, move right into crimps and up
Start on waist high jug rail, move right into overhang, reach out of the roof into the crimps on the face and top it out. Watch out for loose sand and rocks
content.location: Downstream from Pocketsand, near the stairset toproping area

content.description: Sit low with hands on small rail, move high left to another small crack rail, establish good feet and move through the last few intermediate slab moves to the top
Ledgy steps up to an overhang. Can easily be top roped using trees from above.
content.protection: Has been led on nuts and cams but can easily be TR'd using trees.
content.location: Around the corner from Unknown 5.8, look for the blocky steps. There is a small bent tree about 3/4 of the way up the route.

content.description:
There are 2 sections of wall to climb at Doan Brook. The first is rather unimpressive and is about 20 ft high with only a few routes to the top and a few places to boulder. This is located where Delaware St. would be if it continued across North Park into the ravine.  

  The other section is much better and is about 30ft high with many more places to climb. It is located where Roxboro St. would be if it also crossed over North Park into Doan Brook. The wall is around 30ft high and 100ft wide. This has some nice jagged rock with a lot of great holds and lots of opportunities for routes and bouldering. There are also a few sturdy trees leaning over the top that have the possibility of setting up a top rope. The only issue is that in the summer it is constantly moist and thus slippery and has mosquitos and spider webs. 

  The rock can be very dirty and loose, be careful.
